dashboard.description: Metrics from SNMP for Unifi AP

options.content:
RSSI = Signal strength of connection to AP as measured by client.</br>
Signal Strength = Signal strength from client to AP as measured by AP.

panels.description: If you have access points and gateways they will also show up here because they have switch ports.
panels.title: Switch Details

panels.description: Shows data transfer for each subsystem on the site. RX is on the negative axis.
panels.title: Overall Data Transfer

panels.description: Visualize wireless channel usage w/ wired client counts.
panels.title: Clients / Channel

panels.description: Visualize how many clients are connected to which radios/APs.
panels.title: Clients / AP Radio

panels.description: This shows an OUI breakdown from Unifi's perspective.
panels.title: Client / MAC OUI

panels.description: Devices TX / RX bytes per second grouped by OUI. RX on negative axis.
panels.title: Wireless Traffic / Vendor

panels.description: The counters in this table represent uptime totals and do not change with the time range selector. [CCQ=(100 - Error_Rate) * Current_TX_Rate / Highest_TX_Rate | Signa Strength - higher absolute number is better | Radio - usually 'na' = 5MHz and 'ng' = 2.4MHz]
panels.title: Networks / UAP

panels.description: Displays 2.4GHz usage.
panels.title: 2.4 GHz Channel Utilization

panels.description: RX is on the negative Axis.
panels.title: 2.4 GHz Traffic

panels.description: RX is on the negative Axis.
panels.title: 5 GHz Traffic

panels.description: PPS on the ng band calculated in 30 second buckets. In is on the negative Axis.
panels.title: 2.4 GHz Packets

panels.description: PPS on the na band. In is on the negative Axis.
panels.title: 5 GHz Packets

panels.description: In is on the negative axis.
panels.title: 2.4 GHz Drops/Errors

panels.description: Visualize packet errors (several types)  per second in the 5GHz band.
panels.title: 5 GHz Drops/Errors

panels.description:
This table represents current (latest) data.
Bytes columns are lifetime totals.
panels.title: Wireless Devices

panels.description: Visualize wireless channel usage w/ wired client counts.
panels.title: Clients / Channel

panels.description: Visualize how many clients are connected to which radios/APs.
panels.title: Clients / AP Radio

panels.description: This shows an OUI breakdown from Unifi's perspective. e = wired, w = wireless
panels.title: Client MAC OUI Breakdown

panels.description: Bandwidth usage per wireless devices as reported by the UAPs. Rx is on the negative axis. Does not include amazon devices.
panels.title: UAP Bandwidth / Wireless Devices

panels.description: Bandwidth usage per wireless devices as reported by the UAPs. Rx is on the negative axis. Does not include amazon devices.
panels.title: Data Transferred / Wireless Devices

panels.description: Amazon Devices TX / RX bytes per second. Rx is on the negative axis. My home network has a ton of Amazon devices, so I broke them out separately. If you don't have Amazon devices, or they have different names, you can edit the query to use a different name. e = wired, w = wireless
panels.title: Client Bandwidth / Echos & FireTVs

panels.description: Cameras TX / RX bytes per second. Rx is on the negative axis. This graph shows any device with the word "camera" in its name and has nothing to do with UniFi Protect/video products. e = wired, w = wireless
panels.title: Client Bandwidth: Cameras

panels.description: Client reported transmit rate.
panels.title: TX Rate

panels.description: Client reported receive rate.
panels.title: RX Rate

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("ifInDiscards"), 1s) AS "Drop:In", non_negative_derivative(last("ifOutDiscards"), 1s) AS "Drop:Out", non_negative_derivative(last("ifInErrors"), 1s) AS "Error:In", non_negative_derivative(last("ifOutErrors"), 1s) AS "Error:Out", non_negative_derivative(last("ifInUnknownProtos"), 1s) AS "Unkwn:In" FROM "ifTable" WHERE "agent_host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "ifOperStatus" = 1 AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "ifDescr" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("allReqIn"), 1m) AS "GetReq:In", non_negative_derivative(mean("allReqOut"), 1m) AS "GetReq:Out" FROM ( SELECT "snmpInGetRequests"+"snmpInGetNexts" AS "allReqIn", "snmpOutGetRequests"+"snmpOutGetNexts" AS "allReqOut" FROM "snmp.UAP" WHERE "agent_host" =~ /^$host$/ AND $timeFilter) WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

list.description: SNMP Target in Telegraf config - hidden as unclear when we would ever need this variable since Telegraf has different tables for each SNMP target. Will leave variables in queries wherever needed.
list.label: SNMP - Host
list.name: host
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "snmp.UAP" WITH KEY = "agent_host"

list.description: Radio 'mode' - typically 2.4MHz set to NG & 5MHz set to NA but not always
list.label: SNMP - Radio
list.name: radio
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "unifiVapTable" WITH KEY = "unifiVapRadio" WHERE "agent_host" =~ /^$host$/

list.description: Virtual Access Point - virtual ethernet interface on access point - hiding as don't see situation where sorting on this would be needed, will leave variables in queries
list.label: SNMP - vAP
list.name: vap
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "unifiVapTable" WITH KEY = "unifiVapName" WHERE "agent_host" =~ /^$host$/

list.description: Device physical interface - hiding as don't see situation where sorting on this would be needed, will leave variables in queries
list.label: SNMP - Interface:
list.name: intf
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "unifiIfTable" WITH KEY = "unifiIfName" WHERE "agent_host" =~ /^$host$/

list.description: Site (if multiple exist in Unifi config) - hiding as don't see situation where sorting on this would be needed, will leave variables in queries
list.label: Unifi-Poller - Site
list.name: site

list.description: Use "name" or "name AND mac address" in displays
list.label: Unifi-Poller - Identifier
list.name: identifier

dashboard.title: Ubiquity UniFi Access Point [SNMP & Unpoller]
